= Components =
(generated)


*Component items*:
  * *Rectus abdominis (trunk-rectus-abdominis)*: flexion of trunk/lumbar vertebrae; keeping the internal organs intact and in creating intra-abdominal pressure, such as when exercising or lifting heavy weights
  * *External intercostal muscles (trunk-external-intercostal-muscles)*: aid in quiet and forced inhalation
  * *Serratus posterior superior muscle (trunk-serratus-posterior-superior-muscle)*: elevate the ribs which aids in inspiration
  * *Semispinalis dorsi (thoracis) (trunk-semispinalis-dorsi-thoracis)*: extends vertebral column
  * *Transversus thoracis muscle (trunk-transversus-thoracis-muscle)*: depresses the ribs; aids in exertional expiration by decreasing the transverse diameter of the thoracic cage
  * *Subcostalis muscle (trunk-subcostalis-muscle)*: synergist in aiding the internal intercostal muscles with forced exhalation
  * *Transversus abdominis (trunk-transversus-abdominis)*: compress the ribs and viscera, providing thoracic and pelvic stability
  * *Internal intercostal muscles (trunk-internal-intercostal-muscles)*: aid in forced expiration
  * *Serratus posterior inferior (trunk-serratus-posterior-inferior)*: depress the lower ribs, aiding in expiration
  * *Internal oblique muscle (trunk-internal-oblique-muscle)*: compresses abdomen and rotates vertebral column
  * *Pyramidalis muscle (trunk-pyramidalis-muscle)*: tensing the linea alba
  * *Abdominal somatic receptors (trunk-abdominal-somatic-receptors)*: somatic sensation from skin of lower abdomen and lateral side of gluteal region
